summary: Internal FBI email chain from August 2019 regarding the establishment of daily conference calls for the Epstein case, specifically mentioning the need for a CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team) person to join. The emails reference the 'jail incident' and coordinating forensic updates.

persons.name: Sean
persons.role: SSA (Supervisory Special Agent) FBI New York
persons.context: Mentioned as the sender of an email initiating daily conference calls for the Epstein case and requesting a CART person to join.

events.title: Establishment of Daily Epstein Case Calls
events.description: The FBI New York field office initiates daily conference calls at 3:30 p.m. regarding the Epstein case, requesting participation from a CART (forensics) person.

events.title: Epstein Jail Incident
events.description: Referenced in an email asking if the call coordination is for the 'case of the jail incident,' indicating an ongoing investigation or review related to Epstein's death or circumstances in jail.

keyFacts: Daily conference calls for the Epstein case were established by FBI New York starting August 26, 2019, at 3:30 p.m.
The calls were intended to coordinate 'all aspects of the case' and required a CART (forensics) specialist to provide updates.
The correspondence references a 'jail incident' case, likely pertaining to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination between the New York field office and headquarters regarding the Epstein investigation.
